greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)^2 is the smallest square containing exactly n 3's.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Square Number
mathematica: a[n_] := Block[{k=1}, While[DigitCount[k^2, 10, 3] != n, k++]; k]; Array[a, 6] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Jul 27 2018 *)
results.author: _Patrick De Geest_, Mar 15 1999
ext: More terms from _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Jan 11 2009
